sentences:
Frederick William Anderson ( September 28 , 1883 – April 28 , 1955 ) was a civil engineer , rancher and political figure in British Columbia .
He represented Kamloops in the Legislative Assembly of British Columbia from 1916 to 1924 as a Liberal .
He was born in Ottawa , Ontario , the son of William Anderson , and was educated in Ottawa and at McGill University .
After working on a number of large construction projects across Canada , Anderson moved to Kamloops , British Columbia , where he operated a farm and raised livestock .
He married Marion Claire , the daughter of Gordon Edward Corbould .
Anderson served as government whip in the assembly .
He was a lieutenant in the Canadian Engineers of the Canadian Expeditionary Force .
Anderson died in Vancouver at the age of 71 .
